  1. City Council Meetings Move to Monday Evenings

    Posted to News: Blaine on March 22, 2019

    Beginning in April, Blaine City Council meetings will move to Monday evenings. Read More

    Posted to News: Blaine on March 19, 2019

    A new and promising management practice to control phosphorus is using an iron enhanced sand filter (IESF). Read More

    Posted to News: Blaine on March 6, 2019

    The Spring Lake Park - Blaine - Mounds View Fire Department encourages Blaine property owners to contact their insurance companies and inform them of the rating improvement, as the change may reduce insurance rates. Read More

  7. Blaine Activity/Senior Center Project

    Posted to News: Blaine on March 6, 2019

    In early February the city advertised for bids for the construction of a 15,000 square foot senior/activity center to replace the existing, approximately 5,000 square foot, Mary Ann Young Senior Center. Read More

  8. OpenBlaine - Transparent Community Data

    Posted to News: Blaine on March 1, 2019

    In an effort to put more data at the fingertips of Blaine residents, the city is excited to launch OpenBlaine, a new way to understand how the city operates. Read More

  1. spotlight

  1. 2018 Economic Development Annual Report

    Blaine is the fastest growing suburb in the Twin Cities metro area. Blaine's population has grown by over 8,000 residents since the 2010 census and continues to rank high in new housing construction in the metro area.

  1. OpenBlaine - Transparent | Community | Data

    OpenBlaine will allow the general public to easily dig into city budget data as well as other nonfinancial data points collected by the city.

  1. Blaine WorldFest Moves to September

    This event is a great opportunity for the City to recognize and share its growing cultural and ethnic diversity.


  1. Community Connect

    The Community Connect program gives citizens of Blaine a way to join with their neighbors to make our community a safer place to live, work and play.


  1. Blaine Wetland Sanctuary

    BWS is one of Blaine's premier open spaces with over 500 acres of wetland and upland, and a boardwalk extending from Lexington Avenue North through both wetland and upland habitats to connect an existing paved trail to East Lake Park.

  1. Impressions of Blaine

    Show us your best shot! From people, pets, and places to celebrations and locations, you are invited to show us your impression of Blaine!

  1. Blaine Market Returns for Another Indoor Season

    The Blaine Market is proud to connect our community with locally grown and produced products to enhance the life and well being of our residents on select Saturdays this winter season.

  1. Highway 65 Corridor Study

    The study will examine a range of cost-effective roadway alternatives to address capacity, access, mobility and safety issues between Bunker Lake Boulevard in Ham Lake and County Road 10/Mounds View Boulevard in Spring Lake Park.

  1. Impressions of Blaine

    Show us your best shot! From people, pets, and places to celebrations and locations, you are invited to show us your impression of Blaine!
